{
 "cells": [
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Filtered Back Projection"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We'll use the classes of PyTomography to implement filtered back projection in SPECT."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from pytomography.algorithms import FilteredBackProjection\n",
    "from pytomography.projectors import SPECTSystemMatrix\n",
    "from pytomography.metadata import SPECTObjectMeta, SPECTProjMeta\n",
    "from pytomography.transforms import SPECTAttenuationTransform, SPECTPSFTransform\n",
    "from pytomography.utils import HammingFilter\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import torch\n",
    "from pytomography.io.SPECT import dicom"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Creating The Object"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Lets create a 3D rectangle in object space:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "torch.Size([1, 128, 128, 132])"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 2,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "x = torch.linspace(-1,1,128)\n",
    "y = torch.linspace(-1,1,128)\n",
    "z = torch.linspace(-1,1,132)\n",
    "xv, yv, zv = torch.meshgrid([x,y,z], indexing='ij')\n",
    "object_truth = (xv>-0.2)*(xv<0.2)*(yv>-0.15)*(yv<0.15)*(zv>-0.1)*(zv<0.1)\n",
    "object_truth = object_truth.to(torch.float).unsqueeze(dim=0) # add batch dimension\n",
    "object_truth.shape"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.colorbar.Colorbar at 0x7f18ba82fd30>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 3,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 500x400 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "plt.figure(figsize=(5,4))\n",
    "plt.pcolormesh(object_truth[0][:,:,64].T, cmap='Greys_r')\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.colorbar()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We also need to create metadata that accompanies this image. In this case,  we'll assume the voxel sizes are 0.4 cm. For our projection space, we'll assume 120 projections are taken at angular spacing of 3 degrees. We'll assume an acquisition radius of 15cm"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "angles = np.arange(0,360.,3.)\n",
    "radii = 15 * np.ones(len(angles))\n",
    "object_meta = SPECTObjectMeta(dr=(0.4,0.4,0.4), shape=object_truth[0].shape)\n",
    "proj_meta = SPECTProjMeta(projection_shape=object_truth[0,0].shape, angles=angles, radii=radii)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Modeling the Imaging System"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We'll model two different imaging systems here: an idealized imaging system, and a true SPECT imaging system. We'll show that filtered back projection reconstruction only performs well for the idealized system and not for the true SPECT system. The two systems are\n",
    "\n",
    "1. An idealized imaging system characterized by the radon transform. In this case $H$ is simply a projection operator.\n",
    "2. Representative of a true SPECT imaging system, with attenuation/PSF modeling. In this case, $H$ is more complicated.\n",
    "\n",
    "We'll neglect scatter for now (equivalent to assuming perfect scatter correction). We'll show that while filtered back projection does a good job at reconstructing (1), its unable to account for attenuation/PSF modeling in (2)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Case 1:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Our idealized imaging system is simply a SPECT imaging system without attenuation/PSF effects"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "system_matrix_radon = SPECTSystemMatrix(\n",
    "    obj2obj_transforms=[],\n",
    "    proj2proj_transforms=[],\n",
    "    object_meta=object_meta,\n",
    "    proj_meta=proj_meta)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Case 2:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We'll start by creating an attenuation map representative of water with photons at an energy of 140keV ($\\mu \\approx 0.15$ at this energy for water)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "amap = (xv>-0.2)*(xv<0.2)*(yv>-0.15)*(yv<0.15)*(zv>-0.1)*(zv<0.1)\n",
    "amap = amap.to(torch.float).unsqueeze(0) * 0.15\n",
    "att_transform = SPECTAttenuationTransform(amap)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We'll assume imaging using Siemens medium energy collimators "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "collimator_name = 'SY-ME'\n",
    "energy_kev = 140\n",
    "psf_meta = dicom.get_psfmeta_from_scanner_params(collimator_name, energy_kev)\n",
    "psf_transform = SPECTPSFTransform(psf_meta)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now we can create our system matrix that models the SPECT imaging system"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "system_matrix_SPECT = SPECTSystemMatrix(\n",
    "    obj2obj_transforms=[att_transform, psf_transform],\n",
    "    proj2proj_transforms=[],\n",
    "    object_meta=object_meta,\n",
    "    proj_meta=proj_meta)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Obtaining Imaging Data"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We can now use the `forward` method of `system_matrix` to model $g=Hf$ (convert the object $f$ into an image $g$) for the case of (i) the radon transform and (ii) the SPECT system"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "proj_radon = system_matrix_radon.forward(object_truth)\n",
    "proj_SPECT = system_matrix_SPECT.forward(object_truth)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We can look at a projection at 60 degrees for example:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 1500x600 with 10 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig, axes = plt.subplots(2,5,figsize=(15,6))\n",
    "for i, proj_idx in enumerate([0,5,10,15,20]):\n",
    "    axes[0,i].pcolormesh(proj_radon.cpu()[0][proj_idx].T, cmap='Greys_r', vmax=25)\n",
    "    axes[0,i].set_title(f'Angle={proj_meta.angles[proj_idx]}')\n",
    "    axes[1,i].pcolormesh(proj_SPECT.cpu()[0][proj_idx].T, cmap='Greys_r', vmax=25)\n",
    "axes[0,0].set_ylabel('Radon Transform')\n",
    "axes[1,0].set_ylabel('SPECT System')\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Note that the SPECT system yields an image with less counts (due to attenuation) and is blurrier (due to PSF modeling)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Reconstruction"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Filtered back projection is implemented through the `FilteredBackProjection` class"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 11,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    " def filtered_back_projection(proj):\n",
    "    fbp = FilteredBackProjection(proj, angles)\n",
    "    object_prediction = fbp()\n",
    "    return object_prediction"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now we can try reconstructing both the radon transform system and the idealized SPECT system"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "object_radon_fbp_prediction = filtered_back_projection(proj_radon)\n",
    "object_SPECT_fbp_prediction = filtered_back_projection(proj_SPECT)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "And we can plot the central axial slice of each reconstruction"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 1000x400 with 4 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "central_slice_radon = object_radon_fbp_prediction.cpu()[0][:,:,64].T\n",
    "central_slice_SPECT = object_SPECT_fbp_prediction.cpu()[0][:,:,64].T\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(10,4))\n",
    "plt.subplot(121)\n",
    "plt.pcolormesh(central_slice_radon, cmap='Greys_r', vmax=1)\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.title('\"Radon\" System')\n",
    "plt.colorbar()\n",
    "plt.subplot(122)\n",
    "plt.pcolormesh(central_slice_SPECT, cmap='Greys_r', vmax=1)\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.title('SPECT System')\n",
    "plt.colorbar()\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "attachments": {},
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "As can be seen, FBP works well so long as the imaging system is representative of a radon transform. In the case of SPECT imaging, this does not hold."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Additional Filtering"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The high frequency artifacts present in both reconstructions can be removed by applying additional filters during filtered back projection. Here we use a Hamming filter with lower and upper cutoffs of 2% and 93% respectively."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 14,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    " def filtered_back_projection_hamming(proj):\n",
    "    filter = HammingFilter(wl=0.02, wh=0.93)\n",
    "    fbp = FilteredBackProjection(proj, angles, filter=filter)\n",
    "    object_prediction = fbp()\n",
    "    return object_prediction\n",
    " \n",
    "object_radon_fbp_prediction = filtered_back_projection_hamming(proj_radon)\n",
    "object_SPECT_fbp_prediction = filtered_back_projection_hamming(proj_SPECT)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 15,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 1000x400 with 4 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "central_slice_radon = object_radon_fbp_prediction.cpu()[0][:,:,64].T\n",
    "central_slice_SPECT = object_SPECT_fbp_prediction.cpu()[0][:,:,64].T\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(10,4))\n",
    "plt.subplot(121)\n",
    "plt.pcolormesh(central_slice_radon, cmap='Greys_r', vmax=1)\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.title('\"Radon\" System')\n",
    "plt.colorbar()\n",
    "plt.subplot(122)\n",
    "plt.pcolormesh(central_slice_SPECT, cmap='Greys_r', vmax=1)\n",
    "plt.axis('off')\n",
    "plt.title('SPECT System')\n",
    "plt.colorbar()\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  }
 ],
